org.osframework.spring.chronicle.map

Class ChronicleMapBuilderBean<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.AbstractFactoryBean<ChronicleMap<K,V>>
      • org.osframework.spring.chronicle.map.ChronicleMapBuilderBean<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key class type parameter of ChronicleMap to be built
    V - Value class type parameter of ChronicleMap to be built
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Aware, BeanClassLoaderAware, BeanFactoryAware, DisposableBean, FactoryBean<ChronicleMap<K,V>>, InitializingBean

    public class ChronicleMapBuilderBean<K,V>
extends AbstractFactoryBean<ChronicleMap<K,V>>
    Adapter implementation of FactoryBean interface to support creation of a ChronicleMap object through a ChronicleMapBuilder instance. This class adapts the fluent API builder methods of ChronicleMapBuilder to the standard JavaBean API mutator style, for declarative configuration of the details of the created map in a Spring BeanFactory.

    On initialization of the BeanFactory, an instance of this class produces a singleton ChronicleMapBuilder object, which is thread safe. The underlying singleton builder can be safely used to create both singleton and prototype scope ChronicleMap objects.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Dave Joyce
    See Also:
    ChronicleMap, ChronicleMapBuilder

        Parameters:
        keyMarshaller - marshaller used to serialize keys
        See Also:
        setValueMarshaller(BytesMarshaller)

      • setAverageKeySize

        public void setAverageKeySize(double averageKeySize)
        Set the average number of bytes, taken by serialized form of keys, put into the ChronicleMap instance this object builds. If key size is always the same, call setConstantKeySizeBySample(Object) method instead of this one.

        If key is a boxed primitive type or Byteable subclass, i. e. if key size is known statically, it is automatically accounted and shouldn't be specified by user.

        Parameters:
        averageKeySize - average number of bytes, taken by serialized form of keys
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if argument is not positive number
        IllegalStateException - if sample key has been specified

      • setConstantKeySizeBySample

        public void setConstantKeySizeBySample(K sampleKey)
        Set the constant number of bytes, taken by serialized form of keys, put into the ChronicleMap instance this object builds. If key size varies, call setAverageKeySize(double) method instead of this one. By providing the sampleKey, all keys should take the same number of bytes in serialized form, as this sample object.

        If key is a boxed primitive type or Byteable subclass, i. e. if key size is known statically, it is automatically accounted and shouldn't be specified by user.

        Parameters:
        sampleKey - sample key with constant number of bytes for all keys
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if avg key size has been specified

        public void setValueClass(Class<V> valueClass)

        Parameters:

        Parameters:
        valueMarshaller - marshaller used to serialize values
        See Also:
        setKeyMarshaller(BytesMarshaller)

      • setAverageValueSize

        public void setAverageValueSize(double averageValueSize)
        Set the average number of bytes, taken by serialized form of values, put into the ChronicleMap instance this object builds. If value size is always the same, call setConstantValueSizeBySample(Object) method instead of this one.

        If value is a boxed primitive type or Byteable subclass, i. e. if value size is known statically, it is automatically accounted and shouldn't be specified by user.

        Parameters:
        averageValueSize - average number of bytes, taken by serialized form of values

      • setConstantValueSizeBySample

        public void setConstantValueSizeBySample(V sampleValue)
        Set the constant number of bytes, taken by serialized form of values, put into the ChronicleMap instance this object builds. If value size varies, call setAverageValueSize(double) method instead of this one. By providing the sampleValue, all values should take the same number of bytes in serialized form, as this sample object.

        If value is a boxed primitive type or Byteable subclass, i. e. if value size is known statically, it is automatically accounted and shouldn't be specified by user.

        Parameters:
        sampleValue - sample value with constant number of bytes for all values

      • setActualChunkSize

        public void setActualChunkSize(int actualChunkSize)
        Set the size in bytes of the allocation unit of ChronicleMap instances this object builds.

        To minimize memory overuse and improve speed, one should pay decent attention to this configuration. Alternatively, just trust the heuristics and don't configure the chunk size.

        Specify chunk size so that most entries would take from 5 to several dozens of chunks. However, remember that operations with entries that span several chunks are a bit slower, than with entries which take a single chunk. Particularly avoid entries to take more than 64 chunks.

        Parameters:
        actualChunkSize - the "chunk size" in bytes
        See Also:
        ChronicleHashBuilder.actualChunkSize(int)

      • setMaxChunksPerEntry

        public void setMaxChunksPerEntry(int maxChunksPerEntry)
        Set how many chunks a single entry inserted into ChronicleMap instances created by this object could take. An attempt to insert a larger entry causes IllegalStateException. This is useful as a self-check that chunk size is configured correctly and that keys and values take expected number of bytes.

        For example, if setConstantKeySizeBySample(Object) is configured or key size is statically known to be constant (boxed primitives, data value generated implementations, Byteables, etc.), and the same is true for value objects, max chunks per entry is configured to 1, to ensure keys and values are actually constantly-sized.

        Parameters:
        maxChunksPerEntry - how many chunks a single entry could span at most

      • setEntryAndValueAlignment

        public void setEntryAndValueAlignment(Alignment alignment)
        Set alignment strategy of memeory address of entries and independently of memory address of values within entries in ChronicleMap instances created by this object.
        Parameters:
        alignment - new alignment of the maps constructed by this object

      • setEntryAndValueAlignment

        public void setEntryAndValueAlignment(String alignment)
        Set alignment strategy of memeory address of entries and independently of memory address of values within entries in ChronicleMap instances created by this object.

        This method converts the specified text to its Alignment value and then delegates to setEntryAndValueAlignment(Alignment).

        Parameters:
        alignment - new alignment of the maps constructed by this object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if text cannot be converted to an Alignment value

      • setEntriesPerSegment

        public void setEntriesPerSegment(long entriesPerSegment)
        Set actual maximum number of entries that could be inserted into any single segment of ChronicleMap instances created by this object. Configuring both the actual number of entries per segment and actual segments replaces a single setMaxEntries(long) configuration.

        This is a low-level configuration.

        Parameters:
        entriesPerSegment - actual maximum number of entries per segment in maps constructed by this object
        See Also:
        setMaxEntries(long), setActualSegments(int)

      • setActualChunksPerSegment

        public void setActualChunksPerSegment(long actualChunksPerSegment)
        Set the actual number of chunks that will be reserved for any single segment of the ChronicleMap instances created by this object. This configuration is a lower-level version of setEntriesPerSegment(long).

        Setting this property makes sense only if setActualChunkSize(int), setActualSegments(int), and setEntriesPerSegment(long) are also configured manually.

        Parameters:
        actualChunksPerSegment - the actual number of chunks reserved per segment in the ChronicleMap instances created by this object

      • setActualSegments

        public void setActualSegments(int actualSegments)
        Set the actual number of segments in ChronicleMap instances created by this object. With actual number of segments, this configuration replaces a single setMaxEntries(long) call.

        This is a low-level configuration.

        Parameters:
        actualSegments - actual number of segments in maps constructed by this object
        See Also:
        setEntriesPerSegment(long)

        Parameters:
        minSegments - minimum number of segments in maps constructed by this object

      • setLockTimeOut

        public void setLockTimeOut(String lockTimeOut)
        Set timeout of locking on segments of ChronicleMap objects, created by this factory bean, when performing any queries, as well as bulk operations like iteration.

        Timeout expression

        Valid timeout expressions are composed of a long amount and a standard time unit abbreviation. Examples:

         100ns - 100 nanoseconds
 300s - 300 microseconds
 500ms - 500 milliseconds
   10s -  10 seconds
    2m -   2 minutes
    1h -   1 hour
        Parameters:
        lockTimeOut - lock timeout expression
        See Also:
        LockTimeOutParser

      • setPersistedTo

        public void setPersistedTo(Resource persistedTo)
        Set filesystem location to which the ChronicleMap instance will persist its entries off-heap. The specified value must resolve to a File that is readable and writable.
        Parameters:
        persistedTo - off-heap entry storage filesystem location

      • setPersistedTo

        public void setPersistedTo(File persistedTo)
        Set filesystem location to which the ChronicleMap instance will persist its entries off-heap. The specified value must be a File that is readable and writable.
        Parameters:
        persistedTo - off-heap entry storage filesystem location

      • setObjectSerializer

        public void setObjectSerializer(net.openhft.lang.io.serialization.ObjectSerializer objectSerializer)
        Set serializer used to serialize both keys and values in ChronicleMap instances created by this object, if they require:
        • loose typing
        • nullability

        Set this only if custom key and value marshallers are not configured.

        Parameters:
        objectSerializer - generic serializer of entry keys and values

      • setMetaDataBytes

        public void setMetaDataBytes(int metaDataBytes)

        Parameters:
        metaDataBytes - number of bytes allocated for metadata per map entry

        • Required keyClass and valueClass are set
        • The persistedTo property is readable and writable (if set)

                                    throws Exception

        Specified by:
